climatePledgeFriendly.details: Pre-owned Certified: Electronics products are inspected, cleaned and (if applicable) repaired to excellent functional standards. Buying Pre-owned extends a product's life, reducing e-waste and raw material extraction.

features: This refurbished product is tested and certified to look and work like new. The refurbishing process includes functionality testing, basic cleaning, inspection, and repackaging. The product ships with all relevant accessories, and may arrive in a generic box
body.description: The Garmin Nuvi55LM GPS Navigator features a 5" dual orientation touchscreen display and comes preloaded with detailed maps of the lower 49 states. The unit stays unaffected by cellular dead zones as it does not rely on cellular signals. The GPS has a search field that makes finding addresses and millions of points of interest, easier and quicker.The Nuvi55LM makes it easy to look up addresses and navigation with voice-prompted, turn-by-turn directions that speak street names. The unit issues audible alert and displays onscreen warning when approaching a school zone.Nuvi 55LM Features:GPS Vehicle Navigation System5" Wide TouchscreenDual-orientation DisplayFREE Lifetime Map UpdatesSpeaks Street NamesTurn-by-Turn Voice & Visual Guidance

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace the earlier 10 years old model, the battery is no longer holding charge. Base on the past experience, it's good design, very easy to use & navigate, the color scheme is pleasant. Unlike the older model, this one pick up the signal as soon as it's turned on. I use it for a long trip, and out of cellular coverage without worrying to drain my cell phone. My wife use it regularly since it comes with handy, convenient easy to adjust for viewing angle mounting hardware.Update 8/25/17: After 1 and 1/2 years, my wife has been using it regularly. This is a refurb unit, however there is no issue at all, especially with the battery. It's still running strong. Note that the pre-installed map only covers 49 US states. Check your map and update to cover your travel area.8/17 Updates: Over a year and half, we use it regulary - the battery is still running strong

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2017
reviews.reviewText: NUVI 67LMT- Amazing 6" screen for under $100. Unit is solid and functions 100% of the time. no glitches, reboots or freeze-ups. battery life is not so good but i rarely ever use it outside the car and 12v power. LOVE IT!!!Love the easy to follow pictures for lane changes and ramp position. Easy to customize. Thanks Garmin!!Also love the free map updates and traffic

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2016
reviews.reviewText: A pretty darn good system. It can be more time consuming to enter coordinates with this that other interfaces (you must hit spaces between streets: "willow -space- glen" or whatever, instead of entering "willowglen" and getting results).I do not recommend buying is product without lifetime map updates. That used to be a problem with older gps units, and I believe the cost for an update if you don't have lifetime maps is close to the price of a new unit with coverage.I recommend using an inverter with a longer usb cord - mine has an on/off switch so I don't kill my battery if I leave the car for a while. I tucked the wires in trim for a cleaner look and so I don't have wires getting in the way everywhere.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap design, destined to fail, but unit works fine (for now)!
reviews.reviewText: I have an older unit in another car that has worked well for about 10 years. This unit replaces the unit in my wife's car that stopped charging due to a broken receptacle where the power cord attaches. The design allows the mini USB plug to create stress on the circuit board and it eventually failed. This unit is of the same design and will also fail in a matter of time. My older unit has a plug that locks into the receptacle. Bad job, Garmin! Other that that, it works well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No longer working
reviews.reviewText: Worked for about a month, then went haywire. Unfortunately this device decided to quit working just 3 days after the return window. Now comes the nightmare of attempting a warranty repair or replacement. Save yourself some heartache, and spend the extra $50 or so dollars to buy a new device.**Update** I went through the process of trying to get this fixed through the warranty that Garmin supposedly has for this device. The bottom line is, I still have a GPS unit that does not work. This device quit working just weeks after receiving it, and I cannot get Garmin to repair it under warranty. This was the 7th GPS device I purchased through Garmin, and it is my last. I will never do business with Garmin again. I ended up buying a Magellan unit that has worked flawlessly. Garmin, your greed, and poor customer service cost you a long time customer. Thank you Magellan for all that you have done for me, you have a customer for life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good as Expected
reviews.reviewText: The GPS is as good as expected; however, there I a learning curve as it has a few differences from my previous Garmin. I have used it on a few trips now and found no system glitches or obvious errors in the system so it meets all my expectations and is obviously worth its cost as long as it doesn't fail within the next 12 months or so.Lewis J

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as good as the Garmin that it was replacing
reviews.reviewText: So far it has worked OK. I have only used it several times. The only thing I encountered was when I first got it the resolution/screen brightness was at minimum. I thought there was something wrong. After I got in a darker room and could just make out the display. I got the brightness turned up and then all was OK. Works as good as the Garmin that it was replacing. I do kind of like the split screen function it goes into when there are multiple lane options.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2016
reviews.reviewText: We had some concerns about buying a refurbished GPS but this one isTERRIFIC.. It works awesome and we love all of the features that itprovides. The size is great as being we are senior citizens this larger size helps quite a lot. It is easy to work and was not hard toset up or understand. We would recommend this to all .
